column4: UPDATE 2-Vale in deal with two Canadian companies to sell cobalt
column5: June 11 Brazil's Vale on Monday unveiled a $690 million financing to expand a Canadian nickel mine  agreeing to sell unmined cobalt from Voisey's Bay as a booming electric vehicle market propels demand for the critical battery ingredient.

column4: Vale agrees $690 mln future cobalt sale from Canada mine
column5: June 11 Brazilian miner Vale has agreed to sell cobalt mined as a by-product from its Voisey's Bay nickel mine in Canada from 2021 onwards to Wheaton Precious Metals Corp and Cobalt 27 Capital Corp  Vale said on Monday.

column4: More than 25 percent of WPP investors oppose Sorrell pay arrangements: Sky
column5: More than a quarter of investors at WPP  have cast votes against a pay report to be discussed at Wednesday's annual general meeting  angered by benefits for former chief executive Martin Sorrell  according to Sky News reporter Mark Kleinman.

column4: More than 25 pct of WPP investors oppose Sorrell pay arrangements -Sky
column5: June 11 More than a quarter of investors at WPP have cast votes against a pay report to be discussed at Wednesday's annual general meeting  angered by benefits for former chief executive Martin Sorrell  according to Sky News reporter Mark Kleinman.

column4: Turkish Airlines to form venture with ZTO Express and Pal Air
column5: ISTANBUL  June 11 Turkish Airlines  China's ZTO Express and Hong Kong's Pal Air will form a logistics company in Hong Kong  the chairman of Turkish Airlines said on Monday.

column4: Seaboard Corp confident of sealing deal for Kenya's Unga
column5: NAIROBI Seaboard Corporation  is confident of buying out three quarters of minority shareholders in Kenyan agro-processor Unga Group  to allow it to eventually take the company private  Seaboard said on Monday.
